attributes.comment:
If I could deliver a baby, insurance would help cover the costs or medicaid. I am
not asking for hand outs. The process of adoption can be an opportunity for
multiple agencies to 'nickle and dime' you to death and in many ways you will pay
for every paper clip used because of the dream of having a family. I have made
the choice to adopt from the millons of abandoned children and I realize I am
going to half to pay almost $20,000 out of pocket or in my case the cost is being
put on a Visa with 8.9% with very little grumbling. I am aware that I am being
nicked and dimed. My medical insurance will not pay for a physcial or any blood
tests that might be used for adoption. They would pay for all this if I was
pregnant...I guess I was a little put out when I received information that now the
Federal gov't wants to get their nickle and dime me too just because I can't have a
biological child!

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Deborah E. Lafata
